column4: Hi all, I am getting a error: couldn't call CWAP(1) when booting into a clean install of ubuntu 10.10 on a USB drive (booting via grub4dos and then plop), the system continues to boot after this and gets to the login screen, but when i login it freezes/hangs at the end of the login drum sound. I have tried editing the grub switches acpi=off and apm=off with no luck.
I'm running an asus M6Ne laptop
try typinghelp at the prompt and hit enter twice
which prompt are we talking about here?
and what am I trying to achieve by doing that?
not sure walked into this convo   > shoulda kept my muzzle closed but what are you trying to do ?
trying to get a fresh install of 10.10 to boot without freezing on my asus m6ne laptop
ok so u have a iso and trying to install ubuntu from that booting the usb  ?
ok what happens when you boot it ?
did you do an md5 on it first?
you did not answer my ? are you useingwindows or unixto make the boot usb?
just in case you missed it - the iso goes on a USB flash drive. I then boot the flash drive to run the installer and install on a USB hdd
- any further ideas?
i am helping in bactrack pentoo and aircrack and here sorry
- no worries! I'm happy to wait, just thought u'd disappeared
- brb in 10mins
- back
- thanks in any case
sorry i could not help u more and good luck
- no worries :-), ty
